Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat style pottery closed vessel, amphora or oinochoe; exterior, white slip: goat grazing to left (legs and part of rump with added purple remaining); dot rosette, pinwheel rosette, and cross with dashes as filling ornament; below, black band with band of added red band lined in white, and top of lower frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink NAU 3' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p.80 NAU3), the geochemical characteristics of the fabric point to an origin in the region of Teos. For parallels, see NA25, Oxford 119.13 and 119.29.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-9, fig. 1, p. 80) (NAU 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.045)
